page.title: 16SOUTH MOOR MEMORIAL PARK
page.content: In 1920 South Moor Colliery presented a park to the village to commemorate the miners and other local inhabitants who died in the 1914-18 World War. The park today provides tennis courts and bowling greens while the children play on the swings and roundabouts, although the slide has gone.The paddling pool also has proved too expensive to repair and will be made into an extended play area. The whole family can enjoy a walk in extensive natural woodlands through which runs Stanley Burn,crossed in several places by small footbridges.In this area many wild flowers are to be found,as well as cultivated ones in the more formal flowerbeds. The park is now cared for by the local council who continue to provide an attractive family area.
